1970 found Fairport Convention reduced to a quartet after the departure of their singer Sandy Denny. They decided not to replace her and recorded FULL HOUSE, a ferocious blend of high intensity rock dynamics with traditional British Isle fiddle-filled ...    Full Descriptionforms. With accolades accumulating for both FULL HOUSE and its predecessor, the beloved LEIGE AND LEIF, another tour of America was mounted in the late summer.

HOUSE FULL was recorded in Los Angeles at the Troubador. A fine companion piece to its alternately-ordered namesake, these eight songs are a revamped set of the live album released only in the UK. The line-up of the band is extremely impressive, but it was not to last. Richard Thompson left the following year before another studio album was made.

UK remastered reissue of 1986 album for Hannibal that&#039;s out-of-print in the U.S. with 2 added bonus tracks, &#039;Bonnie Kate/Sir B.McKenzies&#039; & &#039;Yellow Bird&#039; both taken from the album Live At The Troubadour (1977). 2001.

Recorded live at The Troubadour, Los Angeles, California on September 4, 5, and 6, 1970.



Richard Thompson - vocals, guitar, dulcimer
Dave Pegg - bass, mandolin
Dave Mattacks - drums
Simon Nicol - vocals, mandolin
Dave Swarbrick - vocals, violin
